Master’s (MS) in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence

  • Home
  • Academics
  • Master's Programs
  • MS in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
AcademicsMore in this section
  • Academics Overview
  • STEM Designated Degree Programs
  • Undergraduate Programs
  • Master's Programs
    • MS in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
      • Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Careers
    • MS in Business Information Technology
    • MS in Computer Science
    • MS in Computer Security and Privacy
    • MS in Data Science
    • MS in Economics and Computer Science
    • MS in Health Informatics
    • MS in Human-Computer Interaction/UX
    • MS in Information Systems
    • MS in Information - Library & Information Science
    • MS in Software Engineering
    • Graduate Minors
    • Graduate Dean's Ambassadors
  • Certificate Programs
  • Doctoral Programs
  • Computer Science Department
  • Information Science Department
Top 10
Best Online Master’s in Artificial Intelligence Program (MastersInAI.org/Degree Prospects, 2023)

Apply Now!

Apply to the Master's in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning program today at the College of Computing & Informatics. Please refer to the application deadlines below:

For Fall 2024:

Fall classes start on Monday, September 23, 2024.

  • International Applicants: June 1, 2024
  • U.S. Applicants (On-campus and Online): August 27, 2024

For Winter 2025:

Winter classes start on Monday, January 6, 2025.

  • International Applicants: October 15, 2024
  • U.S. Applicants (On-campus and Online): December 1, 2024

Who is the Master's in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning program for?

Drexel’s College of Computing & Informatics' Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (MSAIML) provides a strong foundation in the artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning fields with foci on mathematical foundations, algorithms, tools and applications as they pertain to artificial intelligence and machine learning. Students will pursue an applied or computational track and will gain competency in fundamental methods and techniques in artificial intelligence and machine learning. Their foundational understanding will be applied to real data sets and data analysis tasks with the help of state-of-the-art technologies, tools, and platforms. The Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning program culminates with a two-term capstone experience where students work on a real world or research problem using the knowledge they have gained throughout the program.

Note that this degree has two concentrations available: computational and applied.

Fast Facts

Hours

Full-time (FT) or Part-time (PT)

Time-to-Degree

2-3 years (FT); 2-4 years (PT)

Format

On campus or online

Term Starts

Fall, Winter

Curriculum Design

Traditional Course-by Course or Modular Certificate.

Hands-on experience?

Hands-on, collaborative capstone project; Graduate co-op is available for on-campus, full-time students.

Technical experience required?

Yes – a bachelor’s degree in computer science or a STEM-related discipline is required for the computational concentration. Students without a technical background who wish to pursue the computational track will likely need to complete the Graduate Certificate in Computer Science Foundations before beginning this master’s degree.

 

GRE required?

Recommended for international students and for domestic students with a GPA below 3.0

Meets F1 Visa STEM Requirements?

Yes

Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Program Overview

This graduate program explores the discipline's fundamental mathematics, developing related tools, and applying AI and ML to various real-world problems.

Coursework covers a broad, interdisciplinary range of topics, including data science, both theoretical and applied artificial intelligence and machine learning, mathematics and algorithms for artificial intelligence and machine learning, and domain-specific applications. The program culminates in a collaborative, hands-on capstone project.

Courses are taught by CCI’s world-class faculty who have active research experience in machine learning, computer vision, game AI, data science, cognitive science, high-performance computing, software engineering, and applied machine learning in gaming and in security.

Request More Information

Be in touch with us to get answers to all your questions! We can connect you with a Recruitment Specialist, one of our Graduate Dean’s Ambassadors, or a faculty member to help. Contact our graduate recruitment team at cciinfo@drexel.edu and we’ll get back to you soon.

MS in AI & Machine Learning Curriculum

IMPORTANT NOTE: Drexel operates on the quarter, not semester, system, offering classes during four 10-week terms throughout the year. (You are not required to take classes every quarter, but full-time students must complete the degree in 3 years.)

Our master’s degrees are 45 credits (15 courses) which is equivalent to 30-33-credit degrees at other universities. The benefit of the quarter system is that students receive instruction in more topic areas than through the semester system and have more freedom to personalize their curriculum using electives.

This degree is available through a traditional curriculum or a modular certificate curriculum.

Traditional Curriculum

CCI's Master’s Degree in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning consists of:

  • five required courses
  • three required electives, one within each of the following focus areas: Data Science and Analytics, Foundations of Computation and Algorithms, or Applications of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
  • Seven free elective courses that may be selected from the above focus areas or Computer Science Department-approved courses. You will choose your electives to customize your degree based on your goals and interests.
  • A capstone course where students work in teams to pursue an in-depth, multi-term capstone project applying computing and informatics knowledge in an artificial intelligence project.

Full-time, on-campus students who are accepted for fall and winter term admissions can also choose a Graduate Co-op option. Please visit the Steinbright Career Development Center to learn more about cooperative education and its benefits.

Please visit Drexel’s Course Catalog for a full description of each required course and elective for this program. You can also find a sample Plan of Study for the degree.

Modular Certificate Curriculum

This curriculum allows the student to select several certificates in order to 1.) gain a foundation in AIML principles and practice and 2.) focus in-depth on specific skills and knowledge through certificates, customized to your needs and professional goals.

Following the modular certificate option enables you to earn marketable credentials — skills set-based certificates — on your way to completing the master’s degree, and it lets you complete a certificate, step away from the program if you need to, and return to seamlessly pick up where you left off.

In the modular certificate option, you will select:

  • Required core certificate(s)
  • One or two Major Electives
  • Optionally one Flexible Elective

In addition, you may need to take a small number of additional courses in order to complete the degree requirements.

There are a number of possible certificate combinations, and you will work with your adviser and the faculty to create the sequence that best fits your needs and background.

The following certificates can be used to create the MS in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning:

Applied Concentration

Core

  • Applied Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning

Major Electives

  • Big Data Analytics
  • Computer Science Foundations
  • Data Science Foundations
  • Human-Computer Interaction and User Experience Theory and Frontiers
  • Machine Learning for Data Science

Flexible Electives (optionally choose one)

  • Healthcare Informatics
  • Human-Computer Interaction and User Experience Research and Design
  • Information Systems
  • Web Application Development

Computational Concentration

Core

  • Computational Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning

Major Electives

  • Applied Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
  • Big Data Analytics
  • Computer Science Theory & Practice
  • Data Science Foundations
  • Machine Learning for Data Science

Flexible Electives (optionally choose one)

  • Computer Science Foundations
  • Computer Security & Privacy
  • Healthcare Informatics
  • Human-Computer Interaction and User Experience Research and Design
  • Human-Computer Interaction and User Experience Theory and Frontiers
  • Information Systems
  • Software Architecture
  • Software Management
  • Web Application Development

Full-time, on-campus students who are accepted for fall and winter term admissions can also choose a Graduate Co-op option. Please visit the Steinbright Career Development Center to learn more about cooperative education and its benefits.

Admissions Requirements

  • A completed application for the online format or on-campus format.
  • A four-year bachelor's degree or Master’s degree from a regionally accredited institution in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related STEM degree plus work experience equal to Drexel CS Post-Baccalaureate certificate or an equivalent international institution. Please note: Those without a prior degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related STEM degree plus work experience may have to take additional prerequisites before pursuing advanced computer science courses.
  • A GPA of 3.0 or higher, in a completed degree program, bachelor’s degree or above.
  • Official final transcripts from ALL Colleges/Universities attended. Please note: For students who have attended an institution outside of the US, it is highly recommended to submit a NACES approved course-by-course transcript evaluation, i.e. WES, for expedited review of your application. This approved evaluation will take the place of the transcript requirement to complete your application. 
  • Graduate Record Examination (GRE) Scores (must be five years old or less) are not required but recommended for international students and domestic students below a 3.0 GPA.
  • One letter of recommendation required, two recommended (academic, professional, or both).
  • Essay/Statement of Purpose.
  • Current Resume.
  • Pre-requisites for all graduate level programs: computer requirements and skills.
  • Additional requirements for International Students.

Please visit our Graduate Admissions section for application deadlines.

Finances

Tuition

Please visit Drexel’s official Graduate Tuition & Fees webpage. Note that this master’s degree requires 45 quarter credits.

Scholarships

There are a variety of sources of financial aid and scholarships to help you fund your master’s degree — explore them here.

Get in Touch

Our Recruitment Specialists are here to walk you through the sometimes confusing world of financing your graduate education. Get in touch with us now by filling out this form.

Take the Next Step

  • Apply

    Take the next step in your educational journey. Apply today to join CCI's talented and entrepreneurial student body!

    Apply Online

    Request More Information

    Contact us here to get your questions answered about the AI and Machine Learning program's curriculum, our admissions process, student life or anything else CCI-related.

    Contact Us

    Admissions Requirements

    Learn more about admissions deadlines and requirements for the Master's in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning program.

    View Admissions Requirements

    Schedule a Visit or Register for an Online Information Session

    Learn more about the College of Computing & Informatics experience through an online information session or an in-person visit. Contact our recruitment team to schedule your visit today by contacting us at cciinfo@drexel.edu!

    Contact Us

		<script type="application/ld+json">[{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"BreadcrumbList","itemListElement":[{"@type":"ListItem","position":1,"name":"Home","item":"https:\/\/www.cio.com\/in\/"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":2,"name":"Analytics","item":"https:\/\/www.cio.com\/in\/analytics\/"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":3,"name":"Top 10 AI graduate degree programs","item":""}]},{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"Article","url":"https:\/\/www.cio.com\/article\/350315\/top-10-ai-graduate-degree-programs.html","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"CIO","url":"https:\/\/www.cio.com","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject"}},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Thor Olavsrud","url":"https:\/\/www.cio.com\/author\/tolavsrud\/"},"name":"Top 10 AI graduate degree programs","headline":"Top 10 AI graduate degree programs","articleBody":"Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a fast-growing and evolving field, and data scientists with AI skills are in high demand. The field requires broad training involving principles of computer science, cognitive psychology, and engineering. If you want to grow your data scientist career and capitalize on the demand for the role, you might consider getting a graduate degree in AI.\n\nU.S. News & World Report ranks the best AI graduate programs at computer science schools based on surveys sent to academic officials in fall 2022 and early 2023 in chemistry, computer science, earth science, mathematics, and physics.\n\nHere are the top 10 programs that made the list that have the best AI graduate programs in the US.\n\n1. Carnegie Mellon University\n\nThe Machine Learning Department of the School of Computer Science at Carnegie Mellon University was founded in 2006 and grew out of the Center for Automated Learning and Discovery (CALD), itself created in 1997 as an interdisciplinary group of researchers with interests in statistics and machine learning. CALD drew from the Statistics Department and departments within the School of Computer Science, as well as faculty from philosophy, engineering, the business school, and biological science.\n\nCarnegie Mellon says the department\u2019s research strategy is to maintain a balance between research into the cure statistical-computational theory of machine learning, and research inventing new algorithms and new problem formulations relevant to practical applications.\n\nThe Machine Learning Department offers both doctoral and master\u2019s programs in machine learning, including:\n\n2. Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)\n\nThe MIT Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS) is the largest academic department at MIT. A joint venture with the MIT Schwarzman College of Computing offers three overlapping sub-units in electrical engineering (EE), computer science (CS), and artificial intelligence and decision-making (AI+D).\n\nMIT says AI+D\u2019s research explores the foundations of machine learning and decision systems (AI, reinforcement learning, statistics, causal inference, systems, and control), the building blocks of embodied intelligence (computer vision, NLP, robotics), applications to real-world autonomous systems, life sciences, and the interface between data-driven decision-making and society.\n\nThe EECS Department graduate degree programs include:\n\n3. Stanford University\n\nStanford University\u2019s Computer Science Department is part of the School of Engineering. The Stanford AI Lab (SAIL) was founded in 1962 as a center of excellence for AI research, teaching, theory, and practice. In addition to its in-person programs, Stanford Online offers the Artificial Intelligence Graduate Certificate entirely online. The AI program focuses on the principles and technologies that underlie AI, including logic, knowledge representation, probabilistic models, and machine learning.\n\nStanford offers both PhDs and an MSCS with an AI specialization.\n\n4. University of California \u2013 Berkeley\n\nThe University of California \u2013 Berkeley Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences focuses its foundational research in core areas of deep learning, knowledge representation, reasoning, learning, planning, decision-making, vision, robotics, speech, and NLP. There are also efforts to apply algorithmic advances to applied problems in a range of areas, including bioinformatics, networking and systems, search, and information retrieval. It\u2019s closely associated with the Berkeley Artificial Intelligence Research (BAIR) Lab.\n\nBerkeley offers both PhDs and master\u2019s programs.\n\n5. University of Illinois \u2013 Urbana-Champaign\n\nThe University of Illinois \u2013 Urbana-Champaign Grainger College of Engineering focuses its AI and machine learning program on computer vision, machine listening, NLP, and machine learning. In computer vision, the AI group faculty are developing novel approaches for 2D and 3D scene understanding from still images and video, low-shot learning, and more. The machine listening faculty is working on sound and speech understanding, source separation, and applications in music and computing. The machine learning faculty studies the theoretical foundations of deep and reinforcement learning; develops novel models and algorithms for deep neural networks, federated, and distributed learning; and addresses issues related to scalability, security, privacy, and fairness of learning systems.\n\nThe university offers a CS PhD program, CS MS program, a professional master\u2019s of computer science program, and a fifth-year master\u2019s program.\n\n6. Georgia Institute of Technology\n\nGeorgia Tech College of Computing says AI and machine learning represent a large swath of its faculty and research interests, including constructing top-to-bottom and bottom-to-top models of human-level intelligence; building systems that can provide intelligent tutoring; creating adaptive and intelligent entertainment systems; making systems that understand their own behavior; and constructing autonomous agents that can adapt in dynamic environments.\n\nDifferent groups within the school emphasize different areas of research. The core faculty comes from the School of Interactive Computing, but there are also machine learning faculty in the schools of Computer Science and Computational Science & Engineering.\n\nGeorgia Tech offers both master\u2019s and doctoral programs, including a PhD in Machine Learning.\n\n7. University of Washington\n\nThe University of Washington Paul G. Allen School of Computer Science & Engineering offers an AI group that studies the computational mechanisms underlying intelligent behavior. Research areas include machine learning, NLP, probabilistic reasoning, automated planning, machine reading, and intelligent user interfaces. It collaborates closely with the Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence (AI2).\n\nThe University of Washington offers a combined bachelor\u2019s of science (BS)\/master\u2019s of science (MS) program created with industry-bound students in mind, a full-time PhD program, a professional master\u2019s program (a part-time, evening program), and a postdoctoral research program.\n\n8. University of Texas \u2013 Austin\n\nThe University of Texas at Austin Department of Computer Science is focused on computer vision, evolutionary computation, machine learning, multimodality, NLP, neural networks, reinforcement learning, and robotics. It hosts myriad research centers and labs, including the Laboratory for Artificial Intelligence, which opened in 1983 and investigates the central challenges of machine cognition, including machine learning, knowledge representation, and reasoning. Some others include the Institute for Foundations of Machine Learning, Machine Learning Lab, Machine Learning Research Group, and Neural Networks Research Group.\n\nThe University of Texas offers a PhD program, master\u2019s program, online master\u2019s program in computer science, online master\u2019s program in data science, and five-year BS\/MS programs.\n\n9. Cornell University\n\nCornell Bowers CIS College of Computing and Information Science has been building out its AI group since the 1990s. In 2021, it launched a new initiative, a new Radical Collaboration, laid out by scholars across the university to advance its reputation as a leader in AI research, education, and ethics. The initiative expands faculty working in core areas and other domains affected by AI advances. Recent interdisciplinary collaborations across the Ithaca Campus, Cornell Tech, and Weill Cornell Medicine have applied AI to issues ranging from sustainable agriculture and urban design to cancer detection, improving autonomous vehicles, and parsing quantum matter.\n\nCornell offers a Master of Engineering in Computer Science program, as well as a Computer Science Master\u2019s of Science program, and PhD program.\n\n10. University of Michigan \u2013 Ann Arbor\n\nThe University of Michigan Computer Science and Engineering division offers an AI program comprised of multidisciplinary researchers studying rational decision making, distributed systems of multiple agents, machine learning, reinforcement learning, cognitive modeling, game theory, NLP, machine perception, healthcare computing, and robotics.\n\nThe university says research in the AI laboratory tends to be highly interdisciplinary, building on ideas from computer science, linguistics, psychology, economics, biology, controls, statistics, and philosophy. \n\nThe University of Michigan offers a PhD in CSE, master\u2019s in CSE, and master\u2019s in data science.","wordCount":1192,"image":["https:\/\/www.cio.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2024\/01\/shutterstock_2102457385.jpg?quality=50&strip=all"],"datePublished":"2022-05-20T06:00:00-05:00","dateModified":"2024-01-26T02:01:48-08:00","keywords":"Machine Learning,Data Science,Artificial Intelligence,Data Scientist,IT Skills,Careers,IT Training\u00a0","mainEntityOfPage":"https:\/\/www.cio.com\/article\/350315\/top-10-ai-graduate-degree-programs.html"}]</script>		<style>

		<article id="post-350315" class="post-350315 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail category-artificial-intelligence category-careers category-data-science category-data-scientist category-it-skills category-it-training category-machine-learning languages-en editions-us publication-cio publication-us-default story_types-feature origin-wp">
	<section class="article">
		<div class="container grid entry-content ">
			<div class="col-12 col-10@md col-8@lg">
				<div class="core">
					<div class="article__main">
						<div class="grid grid--cols-10@md grid--cols-8@lg article-column">
							<div class="col-12 col-10@md col-6@lg col-start-3@lg">
								<div class="article-column__content">
											<div class="core">
			<p>
				Thinking about getting your graduate degree in artificial intelligence? Here are 10 of the top schools with AI degrees worth pursuing.			</p>
			<p></p>
		</div>
		
			<div class="media-with-label">
				<div class="image">
				<img width="1024" height="576" src="https://www.cio.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/shutterstock_2102457385.jpg?quality=50&strip=all&w=1024" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="He Works on Desktop Computer in College. Applying His Knowledge in Writing Code, Developing Software." data-hero="" loading="eager" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://www.cio.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/shutterstock_2102457385.jpg?quality=50&strip=all 5120w, https://www.cio.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/shutterstock_2102457385.jpg?resize=300%2C168&quality=50&strip=all 300w, https://www.cio.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/shutterstock_2102457385.jpg?resize=768%2C432&quality=50&strip=all 768w, https://www.cio.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/shutterstock_2102457385.jpg?resize=1024%2C576&quality=50&strip=all 1024w, https://www.cio.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/shutterstock_2102457385.jpg?resize=1536%2C864&quality=50&strip=all 1536w, https://www.cio.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/shutterstock_2102457385.jpg?resize=2048%2C1152&quality=50&strip=all 2048w, https://www.cio.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/shutterstock_2102457385.jpg?resize=1240%2C697&quality=50&strip=all 1240w, https://www.cio.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/shutterstock_2102457385.jpg?resize=150%2C84&quality=50&strip=all 150w, https://www.cio.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/shutterstock_2102457385.jpg?resize=854%2C480&quality=50&strip=all 854w, https://www.cio.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/shutterstock_2102457385.jpg?resize=640%2C360&quality=50&strip=all 640w, https://www.cio.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/shutterstock_2102457385.jpg?resize=444%2C250&quality=50&strip=all 444w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px">				</div>
					<div class="media-with-label__label">Credit: Gorodenkoff / Shutterstock</div>			</div><!-- .post-thumbnail -->

											</div>
							</div>
						</div>					
						<div class="grid grid--cols-10@md grid--cols-8@lg article-column">
					  <div class="col-12 col-10@md col-6@lg col-start-3@lg">
						<div class="article-column__content">
<section class="wp-block-bigbite-multi-title"><div class="container"></div></section>



<p>Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a fast-growing and evolving field, and data scientists with AI skills are in high demand. The field requires broad training involving principles of computer science, cognitive psychology, and engineering. If you want to grow your <a href="https://www.cio.com/article/230532/what-is-a-data-scientist-a-key-data-analytics-role-and-a-lucrative-career.html">data scientist</a> career and capitalize on the demand for the role, you might consider getting a graduate degree in AI.</p>



<p>U.S. News & World Report <a href="https://www.usnews.com/best-graduate-schools/top-science-schools/artificial-intelligence-rankings" rel="nofollow">ranks the best AI graduate programs</a> at computer science schools based on surveys sent to academic officials in fall 2022 and early 2023 in chemistry, computer science, earth science, mathematics, and physics.</p>



<p>Here are the top 10 programs that made the list that have the best AI graduate programs in the US.</p>



<h1 class="wp-block-heading" id="1-carnegie-mellon-university">1. Carnegie Mellon University</h1>



<p>The <a href="https://www.ml.cmu.edu/" rel="nofollow">Machine Learning Department of the School of Computer Science at Carnegie Mellon University</a> was founded in 2006 and grew out of the Center for Automated Learning and Discovery (CALD), itself created in 1997 as an interdisciplinary group of researchers with interests in statistics and machine learning. CALD drew from the Statistics Department and departments within the School of Computer Science, as well as faculty from philosophy, engineering, the business school, and biological science.</p>

		
		<div class="jwPlayer--floatingContainer">
			<div id="jwplayer--floatingVideo" class="jwplayer" data-media-id="PXPA4gP3">
			</div>
		</div>
			


<p>Carnegie Mellon says the department’s research strategy is to maintain a balance between research into the cure statistical-computational theory of machine learning, and research inventing new algorithms and new problem formulations relevant to practical applications.</p>



<p>The Machine Learning Department offers both doctoral and master’s programs in machine learning, including:</p>
</div> <!-- Closing article-column__content0 -->
							</div> <!-- Closing col-12 col-10@md col-6@lg col-start-3@lg0 -->
								</div> <!-- Closing grid grid--cols-10@md grid--cols-8@lg article-column0 -->
								<div class="show@md">
										<div class="grid grid--cols-10@md grid--cols-8@lg">
											 <div class="col-12 col-10@md col-8@lg col-6@xl col-start-3@xl">							
												<div class="advert advert--bleed-right">
									<div class="advert__container">										
										<div class="advert__content">									
											<div class="ad page-ad has-ad-prefix ad-article" data-ad-template="article" data-ofp="false"></div>
										</div>										
									</div>
								</div>
											</div>
										</div>
									</div>
					<div class="grid grid--cols-10@md grid--cols-8@lg article-column"> <!-- Open -->
						<div class="col-12 col-10@md col-6@lg col-start-3@lg"> <!-- Open -->
							<div class="article-column__content">


<ul>
<li>PhD in Machine Learning (ML)</li>



<li>Joint PhD Program in Statistics & Machine Learning (offered jointly with the Statistics Department)</li>



<li>Joint PhD Program in Machine Learning & Public Policy (offered jointly with the Heinz College Schools of Public Policy, Information Systems, and Management)</li>



<li>Joint PhD Program in Neural Computation & Machine Learning (offered jointly with the Neuroscience Institute)</li>



<li>Primary Master’s in Machine Learning</li>



<li>5th-Year Master’s in Machine Learning (a one-year program for current CMU students)</li>



<li>Secondary Master’s in Machine Learning (for current CMU PhD students, faculty, or staff)</li>
</ul>



<h1 class="wp-block-heading" id="2-massachusetts-institute-of-technology-mit">2. Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)</h1>



<p>The <a href="https://www.eecs.mit.edu/" rel="nofollow">MIT Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS)</a> is the largest academic department at MIT. A joint venture with the MIT Schwarzman College of Computing offers three overlapping sub-units in electrical engineering (EE), computer science (CS), and artificial intelligence and decision-making (AI+D).</p>



<p>MIT says AI+D’s research explores the foundations of machine learning and decision systems (AI, reinforcement learning, statistics, causal inference, systems, and control), the building blocks of embodied intelligence (<a href="https://www.infoworld.com/article/3572553/what-is-computer-vision-ai-for-images-and-video.html">computer vision</a>, <a href="https://www.cio.com/article/228501/natural-language-processing-nlp-explained.html">NLP</a>, robotics), applications to real-world autonomous systems, life sciences, and the interface between data-driven decision-making and society.</p>
<div id="nativo-1" class="nativo"></div>


<p>The EECS Department graduate degree programs include:</p>



<ul>
<li>Master of Science (MS), which is required of students pursuing a doctoral degree</li>



<li>Master of Engineering (MEng), for MIT EECS undergraduates</li>



<li>Electrical Engineer (EE)/Engineer in Computer Science (ECS)</li>



<li>Doctor of Philosophy (PhD)/Doctor of Science (ScD), awarded interchangeably</li>
</ul>



<h1 class="wp-block-heading" id="3-stanford-university">3. Stanford University</h1>



<p>Stanford University’s Computer Science Department is part of the <a href="https://www.cs.stanford.edu/" rel="nofollow">School of Engineering</a>. The Stanford AI Lab (SAIL) was founded in 1962 as a center of excellence for AI research, teaching, theory, and practice. In addition to its in-person programs, Stanford Online offers the <a href="https://online.stanford.edu/programs/artificial-intelligence-graduate-certificate" rel="nofollow">Artificial Intelligence Graduate Certificate</a> entirely online. The AI program focuses on the principles and technologies that underlie AI, including logic, knowledge representation, probabilistic models, and machine learning.</p>



<p>Stanford offers both PhDs and an MSCS with an AI specialization.</p>



<h1 class="wp-block-heading" id="4-university-of-california-berkeley">4. University of California – Berkeley</h1>



<p>The <a href="https://eecs.berkeley.edu/" rel="nofollow">University of California – Berkeley Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences</a> focuses its foundational research in core areas of deep learning, knowledge representation, reasoning, learning, planning, decision-making, vision, robotics, speech, and NLP. There are also efforts to apply algorithmic advances to applied problems in a range of areas, including bioinformatics, networking and systems, search, and information retrieval. It’s closely associated with the Berkeley Artificial Intelligence Research (BAIR) Lab.</p>
</div> <!-- Closing article-column__content1 -->
							</div> <!-- Closing col-12 col-10@md col-6@lg col-start-3@lg1 -->
								</div> <!-- Closing grid grid--cols-10@md grid--cols-8@lg article-column1 -->
								<div class="show@md">
										<div class="grid grid--cols-10@md grid--cols-8@lg">
											 <div class="col-12 col-10@md col-8@lg col-6@xl col-start-3@xl">							
												<div class="advert advert--bleed-right">
									<div class="advert__container">										
										<div class="advert__content">									
											<div class="ad page-ad has-ad-prefix ad-article" data-ad-template="article" data-ofp="false"></div>
										</div>										
									</div>
								</div>
											</div>
										</div>
									</div>
					<div class="grid grid--cols-10@md grid--cols-8@lg article-column"> <!-- Open -->
						<div class="col-12 col-10@md col-6@lg col-start-3@lg"> <!-- Open -->
							<div class="article-column__content">


<p>Berkeley offers both PhDs and master’s programs.</p>



<h1 class="wp-block-heading" id="5-university-of-illinois-urbana-champaign">5. University of Illinois – Urbana-Champaign</h1>



<p>The University of Illinois – Urbana-Champaign <a href="https://machinelearning.illinois.edu/" rel="nofollow">Grainger College of Engineering</a> focuses its AI and machine learning program on computer vision, machine listening, NLP, and machine learning. In computer vision, the AI group faculty are developing novel approaches for 2D and 3D scene understanding from still images and video, low-shot learning, and more. The machine listening faculty is working on sound and speech understanding, source separation, and applications in music and computing. The machine learning faculty studies the theoretical foundations of deep and reinforcement learning; develops novel models and algorithms for deep neural networks, federated, and distributed learning; and addresses issues related to scalability, security, privacy, and fairness of learning systems.</p>
<div id="nativo-2" class="nativo"></div>


<p>The university offers a CS PhD program, CS MS program, a professional master’s of computer science program, and a fifth-year master’s program.</p>



<h1 class="wp-block-heading" id="6-georgia-institute-of-technology">6. Georgia Institute of Technology</h1>



<p><a href="https://www.cc.gatech.edu/" rel="nofollow">Georgia Tech College of Computing</a> says AI and machine learning represent a large swath of its faculty and research interests, including constructing top-to-bottom and bottom-to-top models of human-level intelligence; building systems that can provide intelligent tutoring; creating adaptive and intelligent entertainment systems; making systems that understand their own behavior; and constructing autonomous agents that can adapt in dynamic environments.</p>
</div> <!-- Closing article-column__content2 -->
							</div> <!-- Closing col-12 col-10@md col-6@lg col-start-3@lg2 -->
								</div> <!-- Closing grid grid--cols-10@md grid--cols-8@lg article-column2 -->
								<div class="show@md">
										<div class="grid grid--cols-10@md grid--cols-8@lg">
											 <div class="col-12 col-10@md col-8@lg col-6@xl col-start-3@xl">							
												<div class="advert advert--bleed-right">
									<div class="advert__container">										
										<div class="advert__content">									
											<div class="ad page-ad has-ad-prefix ad-article" data-ad-template="article" data-ofp="false"></div>
										</div>										
									</div>
								</div>
											</div>
										</div>
									</div>
					<div class="grid grid--cols-10@md grid--cols-8@lg article-column"> <!-- Open -->
						<div class="col-12 col-10@md col-6@lg col-start-3@lg"> <!-- Open -->
							<div class="article-column__content">


<p>Different groups within the school emphasize different areas of research. The core faculty comes from the School of Interactive Computing, but there are also machine learning faculty in the schools of Computer Science and Computational Science & Engineering.</p>



<p>Georgia Tech offers both master’s and doctoral programs, including a PhD in Machine Learning.</p>
<div id="nativo-3" class="nativo"></div>


<h1 class="wp-block-heading" id="7-university-of-washington">7. University of Washington</h1>



<p>The University of Washington <a href="https://www.cs.washington.edu/research/ai" rel="nofollow">Paul G. Allen School of Computer Science & Engineering</a> offers an AI group that studies the computational mechanisms underlying intelligent behavior. Research areas include machine learning, NLP, probabilistic reasoning, automated planning, machine reading, and intelligent user interfaces. It collaborates closely with the Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence (AI2).</p>



<p>The University of Washington offers a combined bachelor’s of science (BS)/master’s of science (MS) program created with industry-bound students in mind, a full-time PhD program, a professional master’s program (a part-time, evening program), and a postdoctoral research program.</p>



<h1 class="wp-block-heading" id="8-university-of-texas-austin">8. University of Texas – Austin</h1>



<p>The <a href="https://www.cs.utexas.edu/" rel="nofollow">University of Texas at Austin Department of Computer Science</a> is focused on computer vision, evolutionary computation, machine learning, multimodality, NLP, neural networks, reinforcement learning, and robotics. It hosts myriad research centers and labs, including the Laboratory for Artificial Intelligence, which opened in 1983 and investigates the central challenges of machine cognition, including machine learning, knowledge representation, and reasoning. Some others include the Institute for Foundations of Machine Learning, Machine Learning Lab, Machine Learning Research Group, and Neural Networks Research Group.</p>



<p>The University of Texas offers a PhD program, master’s program, online master’s program in computer science, online master’s program in data science, and five-year BS/MS programs.</p>



<h1 class="wp-block-heading" id="9-cornell-university">9. Cornell University</h1>



<p><a href="https://cis.cornell.edu/" rel="nofollow">Cornell Bowers CIS College of Computing and Information Science</a> has been building out its AI group since the 1990s. In 2021, it launched a new initiative, a <a href="https://provost.cornell.edu/academic-initiatives/radical-collaboration/" rel="nofollow">new Radical Collaboration</a>, laid out by scholars across the university to advance its reputation as a leader in AI research, education, and ethics. The initiative expands faculty working in core areas and other domains affected by AI advances. Recent interdisciplinary collaborations across the Ithaca Campus, Cornell Tech, and Weill Cornell Medicine have applied AI to issues ranging from sustainable agriculture and urban design to cancer detection, improving autonomous vehicles, and parsing quantum matter.</p>



<p>Cornell offers a Master of Engineering in Computer Science program, as well as a Computer Science Master’s of Science program, and PhD program.</p>



<h1 class="wp-block-heading" id="10-university-of-michigan-ann-arbor">10. University of Michigan – Ann Arbor</h1>



<p>The <a href="https://cse.engin.umich.edu/" rel="nofollow">University of Michigan Computer Science and Engineering</a> division offers an AI program comprised of multidisciplinary researchers studying rational decision making, distributed systems of multiple agents, machine learning, reinforcement learning, cognitive modeling, game theory, NLP, machine perception, healthcare computing, and robotics.</p>



<p>The university says research in the AI laboratory tends to be highly interdisciplinary, building on ideas from computer science, linguistics, psychology, economics, biology, controls, statistics, and philosophy. </p>



<p>The University of Michigan offers a PhD in CSE, master’s in CSE, and master’s in data science.</p>
</div></div></div>					</div>
				</div>

You are here

  • Home
  • Artificial Intelligence, MS

Artificial Intelligence, MS

Considering a career in the exciting field of artificial intelligence? UNT Engineering’s new graduate program may be just the answer. It’s the only standalone Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence in the state of Texas and is one of few nationwide.

UNT’s degree is interdisciplinary, allowing students to leverage their existing skill set and experience by combining it with AI knowledge. Graduate students in our program have the opportunity to specialize in machine learning, biomedical engineering, or autonomous systems. This is a STEM-designated master's program.

According to the World Economic Forum, jobs in AI will grow by 58 million between 2018 and 2022, and Indeed.com reports employer demand for these roles has doubled in the past three years.

 

What to expect

Students can expect to take 6 hours of bridge courses, 15 hours of core courses, and 12 hours of in their chosen concentration.

Bridge courses give students the necessary background in programming and include Introduction to Programming in Artificial Intelligence and Foundations of Artificial Intelligence.

Core courses will dive into deep learning, machine learning, big data and data science, and feature engineering.

Concentration areas focus on machine learning, biomedical engineering, and autonomous systems, offering students the opportunity to choose their own career path.

Students who graduate from this program will be able to:

  • Understand and apply the concepts of programming related to AI
  • Identify and implement AI applications to solve problems
  • Create and utilize AI systems that respond to market needs
  • Analyze and apply AI concepts and applications available in their chosen field of interest
  • Understand the business needs and job market in AI

 

Course offerings

Bridging and Core Courses | 18 Hours (Required for all students)

Course

Credit Hours

CSCE 5214: Software Development for Artificial Intelligence

3

CSCE 5210: Fundamentals of Artificial Intelligence

3

CSCE 5218: Deep Learning

3

CSCE 5215: Machine Learning

3

CSCE 5222: Feature Engineering

3

CSCE 5300: Introduction to Big Data and Data Science

3
Validation and Testing Courses | 3 Hours (Choose one based on your concentration)

Course

Credit Hours

CSCE 5310: Methods in Empirical Analysis

3

BMEN 5007: Research Methods in Biomedical Engineering

3

EENG 5320: Systems Modeling and Simulation

3

MEEN 5140: Advanced Mathematical Methods for Engineers

3
Machine Learning Concentration | 12 Hours (Students choose 4 courses from the list below)

Course

Credit Hours

CSCE 5290: Natural Language Processing

3

CSCE 5380: Data Mining

3

CSCE 5200: Information Retrieval and Web Search

3

CSCE 5216: Pattern Recognition

3

CSCE 5320: Scientific Data Visualization

3

CSCE 5280: AI for Wearables and Healthcare

3

CSCE 5900: Special Problems

3
Biomedical Engineering Concentration | 12 Hours (Students choose 4 courses from the list below)

Course

Credit Hours

BMEN 5322: Medical Imaging

3

BMEN 5005: Neuroengineering

3

BMEN 5324: Biomedical MEMs

3

BMEN 5310: Clinical Instrumentation

3

BMEN 5900: Special Problems

3

EENG 5640: Computer Vision and Image Analysis

3

CSCE 5216: Pattern Recognition

3

CSCE 5225: Digital Image Processing

3
Autonomous Systems Concentration | 12 Hours

Course

Credit Hours

EENG 5640: Computer Vision and Image Analysis

3

EENG 5310: Control Systems

3

EENG 5610: Digital Signal Processing

3

EENG 5900: Special Problems

3

 

Choose your career path

The most in-demand jobs are data scientists, software engineers, and machine learning engineers, but career opportunities in artificial intelligence can span a wide array of disciplines. If you envision yourself in the healthcare industry, then a concentration in biomedical engineering could be perfect. If robotics, self-driving vehicles, or drones are more your speed, then a path in machine learning or autonomous systems could open an exciting field for you. Whichever route you choose, the marketable skills you’ll receive from this program are sure to prepare you for a challenging career in AI.

Marketable Skills

  1. Code using AI programming skills
  2. Design, collect, and analyze data
  3. Solve problems with creative solutions
  4. Quickly grasp new concepts
  5. Collaborate and communicate in teams

 

Admissions

Our program is open to high-achieving students from engineering, computer science, math, and science-related backgrounds. Each applicant’s transcripts will be reviewed to determine if their background is suitable for admission into the concentration of their choice and/or if leveling coursework is required. If leveling coursework is needed, students may be required to take undergraduate leveling courses to prepare for coursework in the concentration of their choice.

Applicants for this program should:

  • Have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA in previous coursework
  • Have taken statistics or linear algebra and have prior programming experience using languages like C++, Java,Python, R, or Matlab
  • Submit transcripts and GRE scores. GRE may be waived for graduates of UNT.
  • International applicants should submit TOEFL or IELTS scores.
  • Submit a resumé (optional)

Send email to kathryn.beasley@unt.edu for more information.

Apply by January 15th to be considered for all funding opportunities.

Apply Online Now

 

Funding your degree

Teaching and research assistantships provide support for many graduate students. In addition to a monthly stipend, assistantships also qualify students for in-state tuition rates, and many students receive tuition and fee support. Scholarships are available to graduate students as well. The general scholarship deadline is March 1 of each year. The College of Engineering also offers scholarships to qualified students throughout the year.

For more information about tuition, visit the online tuition calculator.

(Photo by I-Hwa Cheng—Bloomberg/Getty Images)</div><div class="sc-71fb203c-10 blpAob"></div></div><div id="article-content" class="sc-71fb203c-13 ieIzCg"><div><div data-cy="articleContent" class="rawHtml-content-no-nativo"><p>While <a href="https://fortune.com/education/articles/you-can-launch-your-a-i-cybersecurity-or-data-science-career-in-just-12-weeks-with-these-new-bootcamp-programs/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">buzz about artificial intelligence (A.I.)</a> has largely focused on the growing popularity of tools such as ChatGPT, the demand for jobs and growth in the sector is booming. In fact, <a href="https://fortune.com/education/articles/a-i-is-coming-for-the-jobs-youd-least-expect-and-it-means-everybody-needs-new-skills-coursera-ceo-says/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">49% of workers</a> could have half or more of their tasks exposed to large language models like ChatGPT, according to a <a href="https://arxiv.org/pdf/2303.10130.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">recent study</a> from the <a href="https://fortune.com/education/business/university-of-pennsylvania-wharton/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">University of Pennsylvania</a>.</p><div class="paywall-selector"></div><div class="paywall">



<p>It may not seem like much yet, but the number of job postings related to A.I. accounted for 5.3% of total jobs in the information sector in 2022, according to data from market research firm Lightcast. Plus, job postings in industries not traditionally affiliated with tech, such as real estate, are also seeing an uptick in demand for A.I. skills among candidates.</p><div class="sc-bee345e1-0 gjbbDt <p>But only about one-in-10 workers across the globe has the educational or professional background to fill jobs requiring A.I. skills, according to a <a href="https://www.salesforce.com/news/stories/digital-skills-based-experience/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">recent report</a> by tech giant <a href="https://fortune.com/company/salesforce-com/fortune500/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">Salesforce</a>. </p><div data-cy="instreamAd"></div>



<p>In an effort to meet industry demand, more and more universities now offer degree programs focused on artificial intelligence. Namely, the <a href="https://fortune.com/education/bootcamps/university-of-texas-austin/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">University of Texas—Austin</a>, which <em>Fortune </em>ranks as having top tech bootcamps and <a href="https://fortune.com/education/business/university-of-texas-austin-mccombs/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">MBA programs</a>, announced the launch of its master’s degree program in A.I. in January. </p><div data-cy="instreamAd"></div>



<p>“The fields of artificial intelligence and machine learning have seen unprecedented growth over the last 10 years,” Adam Klivans, a professor of <a href="https://fortune.com/education/information-technology/best-online-masters-in-computer-science/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">computer science</a> and director of the Institute for Foundations of Machine Learning (IFML) at UT—Austin, said in a statement announcing the new program. “Our goal is to ensure that every qualified student can access a premier education in A.I., one that is keeping pace with this rapidly evolving field.”</p><div data-cy="instreamAd"></div>



<p>While there are options to take <a href="https://fortune.com/education/articles/here-are-5-free-ai-classes-you-can-take-online-from-top-tech-firms-universities/" target="_self" rel="" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">free online courses in artificial intelligence</a>, several universities now offer full-fledged degree tracks. <em>Fortune </em>compiled a list of three master’s in A.I. programs to check out if you’re looking to make a career switch. Each of these schools offer other master’s degree programs that <em>Fortune </em>has ranked among the best—including top <a href="https://fortune.com/education/business/best-mba-programs/" target="_self" rel="" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">MBA programs</a>. </p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="h-1-university-of-texas-austin">1. University of Texas—Austin</h2>



<p>UT—Austin offers its <a href="https://cdso.utexas.edu/msai" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">online master’s program in A.I.</a> through its department of computer science and <a href="https://ml.utexas.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">machine learning laboratory</a>, and the degree can be completed at your own pace. The degree covers about two years worth of content. The program is offered on <a href="https://coupons.fortune.com/edx" target="_self" rel="" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">edX</a>, an online education platform, and costs $10,000 to complete, making it one of the more affordable options.</p><div data-cy="instreamAd"></div>



<p>The degree covers A.I.-related topics, including natural language processing, reinforcement learning, computer vision, and deep learning, which prepares graduates for A.I. jobs in engineering, research and development, product management, and consulting.</p><div data-cy="instreamAd"></div>



<p>The <a href="https://fortune.com/education/articles/ut-austin-is-launching-a-new-online-masters-degree-program-in-a-i/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">program quickly skyrocketed in popularity</a>, with more than 4,000 prospective students requesting more information from the university within 24 hours of its launch announcement. Applications for the first cohort open on June 1 and are due by Sept. 15, with an Aug. 15 priority deadline. </p><div data-cy="instreamAd"></div>



<p>Prospective students must <a href="https://www.applytexas.org/" target="_self" rel="" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">submit an application</a> to the Graduate School at The University of Texas at Austin as well as a statement of purpose, resume, and transcripts. Letters of recommendation and GRE scores are optional to submit. Courses start in spring 2024.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="h-2-johns-hopkins-university">2. Johns Hopkins University</h2>



<p><a href="https://fortune.com/education/health/johns-hopkins-university-bloomberg/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">Johns Hopkins University</a> offers both a master’s degree and a graduate certificate in artificial intelligence through its <a href="https://ep.jhu.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">Whiting School of Engineering</a>. The online master’s in A.I. includes 10 courses—four core courses and six electives—and students can take up to five years to complete them. </p><div data-cy="instreamAd"></div>



<p>Curriculum includes algorithms, applied machine learning, and creating A.I.-enabled systems. Johns Hopkins does require <a href="https://ep.jhu.edu/programs/artificial-intelligence/courses/" target="_self" rel="" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">several prerequisite courses</a> including calculus, programming, and linear algebra, but will offer provisional admission for students to complete the required courses prior to enrollment. </p><div data-cy="instreamAd"></div>



<p>GRE scores aren’t required to apply, but most admitted students have at least a 3.0 undergraduate GPA. While the per-course tuition in the engineering school is $6,290, Dean’s support (financial aid) typically brings the cost down to $5,090 for graduate-level courses. This brings the estimated total cost of the online program to $50,900.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="h-3-duke-university">3. Duke University</h2>



<p>At <a href="https://fortune.com/education/business/duke-university-fuqua/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">Duke University</a>, students in the <a href="https://ai.meng.duke.edu/degree" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">artificial intelligence for product innovation master of engineering</a> program can complete courses in-person in 12 to 16 months or online within 24 months. Students can also choose from a variety of learning tracks—or a focus—including data science and machine learning. </p><div data-cy="instreamAd"></div>



<p>The program also includes a capstone project and summer internship. <a href="https://ai.meng.duke.edu/why-duke/graduate-outcomes" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">Graduates</a> take jobs as machine learning engineers, A.I. engineers, data scientists, and data engineers for companies including OpenAI, Doordash, and Target’s A.I. Lab within six months of graduation. All students must complete an <a href="https://ai.meng.duke.edu/courses#pre-program" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">online data science and Python bootcamp</a> the summer before the start of their program.</p><div data-cy="instreamAd"></div>



<p>Students complete 10 courses during the program, covering topics including A.I., machine learning, operations, and management. The management courses are offered through Duke’s Law School and Fuqua School of Business, which <em>Fortune </em>ranks as having the <a href="https://fortune.com/education/business/best-mba-programs/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="sc-bd4ab706-0 dXixpY styledLinkColor ">No. 8 full-time MBA program in the U.S.</a> </p><div data-cy="instreamAd"></div>



<p>The cost of Duke’s program depends on the modality (online or in-person) and the amount of time taken to complete the degree. The in-person program costs about $73,000 while the online program’s total tuition is roughly $95,000. Duke offers limited merit-based scholarships. Applications require transcripts, short-answer essay responses, a resume, three letters of recommendation, and an introductory video. Prospective students have the option to submit GRE scores.</p><div data-cy="instreamAd"></div>

THESE 3 TOP SCHOOLS OFFER MASTER’S IN ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE PROGRAMS","link":""}]},"bypassPaywall":{"postBypassLinkEnabled":"","postBypassLinkUnique":""},"canonicalUrl":null,"channel":"Article Hub","content":"\u003cp\u003eWhile \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/articles/you-can-launch-your-a-i-cybersecurity-or-data-science-career-in-just-12-weeks-with-these-new-bootcamp-programs/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003ebuzz about artificial intelligence (A.I.)\u003c/a\u003e has largely focused on the growing popularity of tools such as ChatGPT, the demand for jobs and growth in the sector is booming. In fact, \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/articles/a-i-is-coming-for-the-jobs-youd-least-expect-and-it-means-everybody-needs-new-skills-coursera-ceo-says/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003e49% of workers\u003c/a\u003e could have half or more of their tasks exposed to large language models like ChatGPT, according to a\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://arxiv.org/pdf/2303.10130.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003erecent study\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;from the\u0026nbsp;\u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/business/university-of-pennsylvania-wharton/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eUniversity of Pennsylvania\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"paywall-selector\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\u003cdiv class=\"paywall\"\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIt may not seem like much yet, but the number of job postings related to A.I. accounted for 5.3% of total jobs in the information sector in 2022, according to data from market research firm Lightcast. Plus, job postings in industries not traditionally affiliated with tech, such as real estate, are also seeing an uptick in demand for A.I. skills among candidates.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eBut only about one-in-10 workers across the globe has the educational or professional background to fill jobs requiring A.I. skills, according to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.salesforce.com/news/stories/digital-skills-based-experience/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003erecent report\u003c/a\u003e by tech giant \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/company/salesforce-com/fortune500/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eSalesforce\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn an effort to meet industry demand, more and more universities now offer degree programs focused on artificial intelligence. Namely, the \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/bootcamps/university-of-texas-austin/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eUniversity of Texas—Austin\u003c/a\u003e, which \u003cem\u003eFortune \u003c/em\u003eranks as having top tech bootcamps and \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/business/university-of-texas-austin-mccombs/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eMBA programs\u003c/a\u003e, announced the launch of its master’s degree program in A.I. in January.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e“The fields of artificial intelligence and machine learning have seen unprecedented growth over the last 10 years,” Adam Klivans, a professor of \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/information-technology/best-online-masters-in-computer-science/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003ecomputer science\u003c/a\u003e and director of the Institute for Foundations of Machine Learning (IFML) at UT—Austin, said in a statement announcing the new program. “Our goal is to ensure that every qualified student can access a premier education in A.I., one that is keeping pace with this rapidly evolving field.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile there are options to take \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/articles/here-are-5-free-ai-classes-you-can-take-online-from-top-tech-firms-universities/\"\u003efree online courses in artificial intelligence\u003c/a\u003e, several universities now offer full-fledged degree tracks. \u003cem\u003eFortune \u003c/em\u003ecompiled a list of three master’s in A.I. programs to check out if you’re looking to make a career switch. Each of these schools offer other master’s degree programs that \u003cem\u003eFortune \u003c/em\u003ehas ranked among the best—including top \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/business/best-mba-programs/\"\u003eMBA programs\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-1-university-of-texas-austin\"\u003e1. University of Texas—Austin\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eUT—Austin offers its \u003ca rel=\"noreferrer noopener\" href=\"https://cdso.utexas.edu/msai\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eonline master’s program in A.I.\u003c/a\u003e through its department of computer science and \u003ca rel=\"noreferrer noopener\" href=\"https://ml.utexas.edu/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003emachine learning laboratory\u003c/a\u003e, and the degree can be completed at your own pace. The degree covers about two years worth of content. The program is offered on \u003ca href=\"https://coupons.fortune.com/edx\" data-type=\"link\" data-id=\"https://coupons.fortune.com/edx\"\u003eedX\u003c/a\u003e, an online education platform, and costs $10,000 to complete, making it one of the more affordable options.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe degree covers A.I.-related topics, including natural language processing, reinforcement learning, computer vision, and deep learning, which prepares graduates for A.I. jobs in engineering, research and development, product management, and consulting.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/articles/ut-austin-is-launching-a-new-online-masters-degree-program-in-a-i/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eprogram quickly skyrocketed in popularity\u003c/a\u003e, with more than 4,000 prospective students requesting more information from the university within 24 hours of its launch announcement. Applications for the first cohort open on June 1 and are due by Sept. 15, with an Aug. 15 priority deadline.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eProspective students must \u003ca href=\"https://www.applytexas.org/\"\u003esubmit an application\u003c/a\u003e to the Graduate School at The University of Texas at Austin as well as a statement of purpose, resume, and transcripts. Letters of recommendation and GRE scores are optional to submit. Courses start in spring 2024.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-2-johns-hopkins-university\"\u003e2. Johns Hopkins University\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/health/johns-hopkins-university-bloomberg/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eJohns Hopkins University\u003c/a\u003e offers both a master’s degree and a graduate certificate in artificial intelligence through its \u003ca href=\"https://ep.jhu.edu/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eWhiting School of Engineering\u003c/a\u003e. The online master’s in A.I. includes 10 courses—four core courses and six electives—and students can take up to five years to complete them.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eCurriculum includes algorithms, applied machine learning, and creating A.I.-enabled systems. Johns Hopkins does require \u003ca href=\"https://ep.jhu.edu/programs/artificial-intelligence/courses/\"\u003eseveral prerequisite courses\u003c/a\u003e including calculus, programming, and linear algebra, but will offer provisional admission for students to complete the required courses prior to enrollment.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eGRE scores aren’t required to apply, but most admitted students have at least a 3.0 undergraduate GPA. While the per-course tuition in the engineering school is $6,290, Dean’s support (financial aid) typically brings the cost down to $5,090 for graduate-level courses. This brings the estimated total cost of the online program to $50,900.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003ch2 class=\"wp-block-heading\" id=\"h-3-duke-university\"\u003e3. Duke University\u003c/h2\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eAt \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/business/duke-university-fuqua/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eDuke University\u003c/a\u003e, students in the \u003ca href=\"https://ai.meng.duke.edu/degree\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eartificial intelligence for product innovation master of engineering\u003c/a\u003e program can complete courses in-person in 12 to 16 months or online within 24 months. Students can also choose from a variety of learning tracks—or a focus—including data science and machine learning.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe program also includes a capstone project and summer internship. \u003ca href=\"https://ai.meng.duke.edu/why-duke/graduate-outcomes\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eGraduates\u003c/a\u003e take jobs as machine learning engineers, A.I. engineers, data scientists, and data engineers for companies including OpenAI, Doordash, and Target’s A.I. Lab within six months of graduation. All students must complete an \u003ca href=\"https://ai.meng.duke.edu/courses#pre-program\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eonline data science and Python bootcamp\u003c/a\u003e the summer before the start of their program.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eStudents complete 10 courses during the program, covering topics including A.I., machine learning, operations, and management. The management courses are offered through Duke\u0026#8217;s Law School and Fuqua School of Business, which \u003cem\u003eFortune \u003c/em\u003eranks as having the \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/business/best-mba-programs/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\"\u003eNo. 8 full-time MBA program in the U.S.\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe cost of Duke\u0026#8217;s program depends on the modality (online or in-person) and the amount of time taken to complete the degree. The in-person program costs about $73,000 while the online program’s total tuition is roughly $95,000. Duke offers limited merit-based scholarships. Applications require transcripts, short-answer essay responses, a resume, three letters of recommendation, and an introductory video. Prospective students have the option to submit GRE scores.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eCheck out all of\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003eFortune’\u003cem\u003es\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/\"\u003e\u003cem\u003erankings of degree programs\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e, and learn more about specific\u0026nbsp;\u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/education/careers/\"\u003e\u003cem\u003ecareer paths\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e","databaseId":3749495,"dateGmt":"2023-06-16T17:32:58","dek":"","description":"Fortune compiled a list of three master’s in A.I. programs to check out if you’re looking to make a career switch.","faq":[],"featuredMediaType":"image","floatingNavContent":"","floatingNavTitle":"","id":"cG9zdDozNzQ5NDk1","image":"https://content.fortune.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/GettyImages-1258279957.jpg?resize=1200,600","imageCaption":"Signage for artificial intelligence during the Taipei Computex expo in Taipei, Taiwan, as seen in May 2023. The in-person program costs about $73,000 while the online program’s total tuition is roughly $95,000. Duke offers limited merit-based scholarships. Thank you for your interest in Drexel University's College of Computing & Informatics (CCI)! Please make sure to note the application deadlines below for upcoming enrollment terms as well as admissions requirements for your desired program and computer & technology requirements.

We also encourage you to learn more about life as a Drexel graduate student by visiting our Student Experience and/or Current Students sections, where you can read about student life at CCI, mentor programs, the online environment, and our state-of-the-art facilities. You can also contact our Graduate Dean's Ambassadors to learn more about the Drexel experience from current students.

Master's & Certificate Programs Admissions Deadlines

Fall 2024 - On-Campus and Online Programs

Fall classes start on Monday, September 23, 2024. View Drexel University's Academic Calendar

  • Domestic On-Campus & Online Students: Deadline for completed applications with all materials received is Tuesday, August 27, 2024.
  • International Students: Deadline for completed applications with all materials received is Saturday, June 1, 2024.

Apply for an On Campus Master's or Certificate Program

Apply for an Online Master's or Certificate Program

Winter 2025 - On-Campus and Online Programs

Winter classes start on Monday, January 6, 2025. View Drexel University's Academic Calendar

  • Domestic On-Campus & Online Students: Deadline for completed applications with all materials received is Sunday, December 1, 2024.
  • International Students: Deadline for completed applications with all materials received is Tuesday, October 15, 2024.

Apply for an On Campus Master's or Certificate Program

Apply for an Online Master's or Certificate Program

Doctoral Programs Admissions Deadlines

For PhD program deadlines, please visit our Doctoral Admissions section.

Graduate Funding Options

Learn more about funding, discount and scholarship opportunities to help offset the cost of your master's degree.

Information for Accepted Graduate Students

Have you been accepted into a master's or certificate program at Drexel CCI? Visit our Accepted Students webpage to learn about next steps in your enrollment. International students are encouraged to review our International Applicants webpage for additional requirements.

Admissions Requirements for Master's & Certificate Programs

Students applying to the following master's and certificate programs should read and follow the admissions requirements carefully prior to submitting an application. For PhD admissions requirements, please visit our Doctoral Admissions section.

Master's Degree Admissions Requirements

  • MS in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
  • MS in Business Information Technology
  • MS in Computer Science
  • MS in Computer Security and Privacy
  • MS in Economics and Computer Science
  • MS in Data Science
  • MS in Health Informatics
  • MS in Human-Computer Interaction and User Experience
  • MS in Information - Library and Information Science
  • MS in Information Systems
  • MS in Software Engineering

Graduate Certificate Program Admissions Requirements

  • Applied Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for Data Science
  • Applied Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
  • Big Data Analytics
  • Community-based Librarianship
  • Computational Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
  • Computational Data Science
  • Computer Security and Privacy
  • Computer Science Foundations
  • Computer Science Theory & Practice
  • Data Science Foundations
  • Digital Transformation

  • Human-Computer Interaction and User Experience Research and Design
  • Human-Computer Interaction and User Experience Theory and Frontiers
  • Information Systems
  • Information Systems Development
  • Information Technology Management
  • Information Technology Strategy & Execution
  • Machine Learning for Data Science
  • Organizational Security
  • Software Architecture
  • Software Management
  • Web Application Development

Do you have questions about applying to Drexel CCI?

Our recruitment team is eager to answer your questions and assist you throughout your application process. Email us at cciinfo@drexel.edu and we'll get back to you soon!

SUB MENU
  • Artificial Intelligence
    • Admission Requirements
    • Degree Requirements
    • Apply Online
    • Graduate Courses
    • Program Worksheet (pdf)
 

MS with Major in Artificial Intelligence

The Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science are proud to offer Florida’s first MS program in Artificial Intelligence!  Be at the forefront of the fourth industrial revolution, as AI is transforming every industry.  Our innovative program and training curriculum cover AI theory, methods, and technologies. We are educating students and training professionals to develop new skills for jobs that are not yet defined, so they can join the first generation of an AI-and-autonomy workforce.  Applicants for admission to the master’s program are approved by the University upon the recommendation of the department.  All applicants must submit with their application the official transcripts from previous institutions attended and have official GRE scores forwarded to the University.  Applications for admission are evaluated on an individual basis. The Master of Science with Major in Artificial Intelligence program offers both thesis and non-thesis options. Both options require a minimum of 30 credits, as specified in Degree Requirements.  58 million jobs will be created in AI by 2022. Demand for AI professionals increased 423 percent across the state, with tremendous earning potential in careers such as artificial intelligence scientist, machine learning engineer, software architect, data scientist, survey statistician, research analyst, or robotics engineer.

  <template class="tplGlassMoonGeneric Default Optionx1" id="tplGlassMoonGenericOptionx1">
        <div class="template-Glass-Moon-Generic DuoColumnar template">
      <div class="inner-wrap">
        <div class="exoskeleton content background-main">
                    <div class="lower">
            <div class="right-lane">
              <div class="copy paragraph">
                <h3>Learning Outcomes</h3>
<p>Students who complete the MSAI program will be able to:</p>
<ul>
<li>Understand representations, algorithms, and techniques used across the AI industry and be able to apply and evaluate them in applications as well as develop their own</li>
<li>Understand the basic processes that an agent must perform, from perceiving its environment, making decisions on how to act and performing those actions, as well be able to develop and evaluate the technology that can be used to perform these processes</li>
<li>Understand and apply machine learning techniques to draw inferences from data and help automate the development of AI systems and components</li>
<li>Understand the various ways and reasons humans are integrated into mixed human-AI environments, whether it is to improve overall integrated system performance, improve AI performance, or influence human performance and learning</li>
<li>Understand the ethical concerns in developing responsible AI technologies</li>
<li>Model human behavior, develop human-AI systems, and evaluate their performance</li>
<li>Demonstrate knowledge of the use of AI algorithms and processes in one of the specialization areas: robotics and agent-based systems, vision, intelligent interaction, machine learning, and knowledge representation and reasoning</li>
</ul>
              </div>

            </div>
            <div class="left-lane">
              <div class="copy paragraph">
                <h3>Futures on the forefront</h3>
<p>MSAI graduates can find success in a wide range of careers, including:</p>
<ul>
<li>Machine Intelligence Engineer</li>
<li>AI Programmer</li>
<li>Natural Language Processing Developer</li>
<li>QA Automation Engineer</li>
</ul>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

      </div>
    </div>

LUX.samplerate = 5;
LUX.label = 'article-desktop-a';
if ('hardwareConcurrency' in navigator)
	LUX.addData('navigator_hardwareConcurrency', navigator.hardwareConcurrency);
if ('connection' in navigator)
	var navigatorConnectionList = [
		'downlink',
		'effectiveType',
		'rtt',
		'saveData',
	]
	navigatorConnectionList.forEach((item) => {
		if (item in navigator.connection) {
			LUX.addData(`navigator_connection_${item}`, navigator.connection[item]);
		}
	});
if ('deviceMemory' in navigator)
	LUX.addData('navigator_deviceMemory', navigator.deviceMemory);

	navigator.getBattery().then((battery) => {
		LUX.addData('navigator_getBattery_level', battery.level);
		LUX.addData('navigator_getBattery_charging', battery.charging);
	});
if ('storage' in navigator)
